question: Question_01_(f)
sols:
By the chain rule,

\begin{align*}\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{1}{f(2x)}f'(2x)\cdot 2\end{align*} When $x=1,$ this is
equal to

\begin{align*}\frac{1}{f(2)}f'(2)\cdot 2 =\frac{1}{3} (-5)\cdot 2 = -\frac{10}{3}.\end{align*}
Hence, the slope of the tangent line at $x=1$ is equal to $-10/3.$
hints:
The slope of the graph at $x=1$ is simply the derivative, $dy/dx,$
evaluated when $x=1.$
Use the chain rule to find the derivative, $dy/dx.$
